intro: Webera dallachiana, commonly known as the Dallachian fern, is a species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in cloud forests. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce dense clusters of foliage. The leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
